Business¶

This will detail the modules that implement the application’s business rules.

User¶

business.user.delete_user(id_user: int) → bool¶

Deletes a user.

Parameters

id_user (int) – User to be deleted.

Raises

DeleteUserException – The user entered cannot be found.

Returns

True if the user is successfully deleted.

Return type

bool

business.user.insert_user(user: user_api.entities.user.User) → int¶

Inserts a user into the database, encrypting sensitive data. Sanitizes the cpf and phone data, removing non-numeric characters.

Parameters

user (user_entity) – Instance of the class entities.user.User.

Raises

UserAlreadyInserted – The cpf number entered already exists in the database.

Returns

Id of the user inserted into the database.

Return type

int

business.user.list_all(quantity: int, page: int) → list¶

Lists all users in the database, paginating the result. Decrypting the retrieved data in the database.

Parameters

  • quantity (int) – Number of users per page.

  • page (int) – Result page.

Returns

List of all users found in the database.

Return type

list

business.user.list_one(id_user: int) → user_api.entities.user.User¶

Returns the user from their id. Decrypting the data retrieved from the database.

Parameters

id_user (int) – User id.

Raises

GetUserException – The user entered was not found.

Returns

Instance of class entities.user.User.

Return type

entities.user.User.

business.user.update_user(id_user: int, update_data: dict) → bool¶

Updates a user.

Parameters

  • id_user (int) – Id of the user to be updated.

  • update_data (dict) – Dictionary in column format: value of the data that to be updated.

Raises

UpdateUserException – The user was not found in the database.

Returns

True if the user was successfully updated.

Return type

bool
